javax.portlet

Interface MethodToken


  • public interface MethodToken
    Interface designating an implementation-specific token used for annotated method invocation. The token represents a single candidate method for conditional dispatching.
    See Also:
    ConditionalDispatcher, ConditionalDispatchMethod

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <A extends Annotation> 
      A      		 getAnnotation(Class<A> annotationClass)
      Returns the annotation on the candidate method of the given type if present, otherwise null.
      Annotation[] getAnnotations()
      Returns an array containing all annotations present on the candidate method.
      boolean isAnnotationPresent(Class<? extends Annotation> annotationClass)
      Returns true if an annotation of the given type is present on the candidate method, else false.

    • Method Detail

      • getAnnotation

        <A extends Annotation> A getAnnotation(Class<A> annotationClass)
        Returns the annotation on the candidate method of the given type if present, otherwise null.
        Parameters:
        annotationClass - The annotation type to be returned
        Returns:
        The annotation on the candidate method of the given type, otherwise null.

      • getAnnotations

        Annotation[] getAnnotations()
        Returns an array containing all annotations present on the candidate method.
        Returns:
        The array of all candidate method annotations.

      • isAnnotationPresent

        boolean isAnnotationPresent(Class<? extends Annotation> annotationClass)
        Returns true if an annotation of the given type is present on the candidate method, else false. This method is designed primarily for convenient access to marker annotations.
        Returns:
        true if the given annotation type is present
